job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: Job Description The Purpose of Your Role Fidelity Workplace Investing is seeking a Data Scientist to support our Customer Inclusion initiatives. This position will work with technical professionals in data science and with managers of market research and product development teams. The assignments may include exploratory analysis, feature engineering, cluster analysis, predictive analytics, causal inference, and presentation of findings. As Data Scientists, we support projects across many areas and ensure the highest degree of quality. You must be a great teammate who thrives in a small, highly effective work environment and communicates with confidence to all levels of Workplace Investing. The ideal Data Scientist handles projects from start to finish. i.e., they can work with market research on survey design, gather required data in any shape and size, process the data, analyze them graphically and statistically, draw useful and unique insights, package the information into effective presentations, and present results to colleagues and business partners. The Skills You Bring Data extraction and feature engineering for processing and transforming data into relevant features. Statistical and data science programming with proficiency in Python or R. Quantitative research, including survey design and analysis, factor and principle components analysis, experimental design, causal inference, or other related fields. Exploratory data analysis, statistical graphics, and effective data visualization. Committed to continuous learning and able to pick up new knowledge quickly. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, especially regarding technical communication. Able to communicate technical information to individuals at all levels of technical expertise. E ducation Master’s Degree in a quantitative or computational field (e.g. Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Economics, Operations Research, or Applied Mathematics), with applied research experience. Master’s Degree in a social or biological science field (e.g. Biology, Bioinformatics, Sociology, or Psychology) with quantitative research experience. How Your Work Impacts the Organization As a Data Scientist in Fidelity Workplace Investments, you will use analytics to help Fidelity product owners and technologists identify underserved segments in Fidelity’s customer base. You will assist in designing solutions for those individuals and measuring success for products that are launched. This is a growing and critical element of Fidelity’s business strategy. Company Overview At Fidelity, we are passionate about making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want! We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associate for their unique perspectives and experiences. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com. Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.
